questions.question: What is the primary role of SEBI in preventing fraud?
options: Guaranteeing investment returns
Regulating and monitoring market participants
Providing stock tips
questions.correctAnswer: Regulating and monitoring market participants

questions.question: Which of these is a major red flag for an investment scheme?
options: Guaranteed high returns with no risk
SEBI registration number provided
Transparent fee structure
questions.correctAnswer: Guaranteed high returns with no risk

questions.question: What is a pump-and-dump scheme?
options: A scheme to get a lot of people to invest in a new company
Artificially inflating a stock's price to sell it at a profit
A type of mutual fund
questions.correctAnswer: Artificially inflating a stock's price to sell it at a profit

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of a Ponzi scheme?
options: It invests in a secret, high-performing asset.
It uses money from new investors to pay returns to earlier investors.
It is a government-approved savings scheme.
questions.correctAnswer: It uses money from new investors to pay returns to earlier investors.

questions.question: What is insider trading?
options: Trading stocks based on tips from friends.
Trading based on material, non-public information about a company.
Trading stocks of a company you work for.
questions.correctAnswer: Trading based on material, non-public information about a company.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common channel for investment fraud in India?
options: Official bank websites
SEBI's official website
WhatsApp and Telegram groups
questions.correctAnswer: WhatsApp and Telegram groups

questions.question: What is the best way to verify an investment advisor?
options: Trust their social media profile.
Check their registration status on the SEBI website.
Believe their claims of high returns.
questions.correctAnswer: Check their registration status on the SEBI website.

questions.question: What is a common tactic used in phishing scams?
options: Offering a free trial of a new product.
Creating a sense of urgency to get you to act quickly.
Providing detailed research reports.
questions.correctAnswer: Creating a sense of urgency to get you to act quickly.

questions.question: What is circular trading?
options: Trading stocks in a circular pattern on a chart.
A group of traders creating artificial trading volume among themselves.
A type of day trading strategy.
questions.correctAnswer: A group of traders creating artificial trading volume among themselves.

questions.question: What is front running?
options: Being the first to invest in a new IPO.
Brokers using advance knowledge of large client orders for personal gain.
A strategy for predicting market trends.
questions.correctAnswer: Brokers using advance knowledge of large client orders for personal gain.

questions.question: What is a key feature of a legitimate investment?
options: It is always risk-free.
It is always promoted by celebrities.
It has a clear and transparent business model.
questions.correctAnswer: It has a clear and transparent business model.

questions.question: What should you do if you receive an unsolicited stock tip?
options: Invest immediately to not miss out.
Be skeptical and do your own research.
Share the tip with your friends.
questions.correctAnswer: Be skeptical and do your own research.

questions.question: What is a common characteristic of a fake trading app?
options: It is available on the official app stores.
It promises unrealistically high and consistent returns.
It has a user-friendly interface.
questions.correctAnswer: It promises unrealistically high and consistent returns.

questions.question: What is the purpose of SEBI's investor education initiatives?
options: To provide stock recommendations.
To promote specific investment products.
To increase financial literacy and awareness among investors.
questions.correctAnswer: To increase financial literacy and awareness among investors.

questions.question: What is a key difference between a Ponzi scheme and a pyramid scheme?
options: Ponzi schemes are legal, while pyramid schemes are not.
Pyramid schemes rely on recruiting new members to generate returns.
Ponzi schemes only invest in real estate.
questions.correctAnswer: Pyramid schemes rely on recruiting new members to generate returns.

questions.question: What is a common red flag of a fraudulent investment advisor?
options: They are registered with SEBI.
They have a professional website.
They pressure you to make quick investment decisions.
questions.correctAnswer: They pressure you to make quick investment decisions.

questions.question: What is the main risk of investing in a company involved in a pump-and-dump scheme?
options: The company might go bankrupt.
The stock price will likely crash after the manipulators sell their shares.
The company might be delisted from the stock exchange.
questions.correctAnswer: The stock price will likely crash after the manipulators sell their shares.

questions.question: What is the best way to protect yourself from phishing scams?
options: Use the same password for all your accounts.
Never click on links in suspicious emails and always go directly to the official website.
Reply to the email to verify if it's legitimate.
questions.correctAnswer: Never click on links in suspicious emails and always go directly to the official website.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of circular trading?
options: To reduce the risk of an investment.
To create an artificial sense of high trading volume and liquidity.
To get a tax benefit.
questions.correctAnswer: To create an artificial sense of high trading volume and liquidity.

questions.question: What is the most important thing to remember when you are offered an investment opportunity?
options: If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.
The higher the risk, the higher the return.
You should always trust your friends' investment advice.
questions.correctAnswer: If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.
